item.title: Amos 1
item.description:
Amos Chapter 1

1 The Message of Amos, Shepherd from Tekoa, That He Saw About Israel at the Time of Uzziah, King of Judah, and Jeroboam Ben-Joash, King of Israel, Two Years Before the Earthquake

2 He said, “Yahveh will roar from Zion; he’ll thunder from Jerusalem. The shepherds’ pastures will dry up; the grass on Carmel’s summit will wither away.” God’s Judgment on Israel’s Neighbors

3 Yahveh says, “For three sins of Damascus and for four, I won’t hold back its punishment:e said, He said they threshed the people of Gilead with sledges that had iron teeth.

item.title: Amos 2
item.description:
Amos Chapter 2

1 Yahveh says, “For three sins of Moab and for four, I won’t hold back its punishment: they burned the king of Edom’s bones into lime.

2 So I’ll burn the fortresses in Kerioth; Moab will die amid turmoil, war cries, and bugle blasts.

3 I’ll eliminate judges from him and slay his officials with him.” God’s Judgment on Judah and Israel

4 Yahveh says, “For three sins of Judah and for four, I won’t hold back its punishment: they rejected the Law of Yahveh and didn’t keep his statutes. The same lies have led them astray that their ancestors followed.

item.title: Amos 3
item.description:
Amos Chapter 3

1 Listen to what Yahveh says against you, Israel, against the entire family he brought out of Egypt: 2"Of all the families in the world, only you have me; so I’ll punish you for your sins.

3 Can two men walk together unless they’ve agreed on their route?

4 Does a lion roar in the woods before it’s made a kill? Does a young lion growl in his den if he’s taken nothing?

item.title: Amos 4
item.description:
Amos Chapter 4

1 Listen to this, you cows of Bashan living in Samaria, you women that oppress the poor and crush the needy, that tell their husbands, “Bring the wine so we can get drunk!"

2 The Lord Yahveh has sworn by his holiness, “The time’s coming when they’ll take you away with meat hooks, the last of you like fish on hooks.

3 You’ll leave through the breaches in the walls, each one straight ahead. You’ll be thrown out into Harmon/Mt. Hermon.” 4"Go sacrifice at Bethel and sin; multiply your disobedience in Gilgal! Bring your sacrifices every morning, your tithes every three days.

item.title: Amos 5
item.description:
Amos Chapter 5

1 Listen to the dirge I’m chanting for you, Israel: 2"She’s fallen; virgin Israel won’t get up again. She’s abandoned on the ground; no one will help get her up.

3 The city that goes out 1,000 strong will have 100 left; the one that goes out 100 strong will have 10."

4 Yahveh tells Israel, “Rely on me so you can live.

5 Don’t rely on Bethel or go to Gilgal or Beersheba; Gilgal is headed for captivity, and Bethel will cease to exist.

item.title: Amos 6
item.description:
Amos Chapter 6

1 Misfortune awaits those of you at ease in Zion, who feel secure in Samaria, you notable leaders of that foremost nation that the House of Israel comes to.

2 Go over to Calneh and look at what happened there; go from there to Hamath the great city; then go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are you better than those kingdoms? Is their territory bigger than yours?

item.title: Amos 7
item.description:
Amos Chapter 7

1 The Lord Yahveh showed me a vision. He formed a locust swarm after the spring crop sprouted and the king had mowed his share. 2The swarm had finished eating the vegetation, and I said, “Lord Yahveh, please pardon! How will Joseph make it? He’s too small!"

3 Yahveh changed his mind. “It won’t happen.” A Vision of Fire

4 The Lord Yahveh showed me another vision: he had called for fire to punish them. It had burned up the depths of the sea and was beginning to burn up the landscape. 5I said, “Lord Yahveh, please stop! How can Joseph make it? He’s too small!"

item.title: Amos 8
item.description:
Amos Chapter 8

1 The Lord Yahveh showed me a basket of ripe fruit. 2"What do you see, Amos?" “A basket of ripe fruit.” “My people Israel are also ripeâ€”for punishment. I won’t spare them any longer. 3The singing at the palace will turn into wailing. There’ll be lots of corpses silently thrown out everywhere."

4 Listen to this, you that run over the needy and trample on the humble, 5saying, “When’s the new moon going to be over so we can buy grain? When will the Sabbath be past so we can open the wheat market, make the bushel smaller, the shekel heavier, and cheat with dishonest scales;

item.title: Amos 9
item.description:
Amos Chapter 9

1 I saw Yahveh standing by the altar. He said, “Strike the capitals till the thresholds shake; shatter them on the people’s heads. What’s left, I’ll slay with the sword; no fugitive will get away or refugee escape.

2 Though they dig down to Sheol, I’ll bring them up. Though they fly up to the sky, I’ll bring them down.

3 Though they hide on top of Carmel, I’ll look for them and banish them. Though they hide on the floor of the sea, I’ll tell a sea serpent to bite them.
